results.content: Christian Wait 10 hours Ago. CES 2024 Anker Innovations had revealed brand new tech In the bustling city of Las Vegas, showcasing a range of high-tech products. From today until January 12, 2024, the event features Anker's diverse sub-brands at the Venetian Expo. Let's breakdown every CES 2024 Anker Innovations reveal below:
results.raw_content:
CES 2024: Anker Innovations Reveals New Tech
CES 2024 Anker Innovations had revealed brand new tech In the bustling city of Las Vegas, showcasing a range of high-tech products. From today until January 12, 2024, the event features Anker’s diverse sub-brands at the Venetian Expo. Let’s breakdown every CES 2024 Anker Innovations reveal below:
Read More: Anker Solix F1200 Review
Eufy Clean X10 Omni – CES 2024 Anker Innovations
The Eufy clean X10 Omni, a robust robot hoover, highlights the show. This model merges Eufy X9 Pro’s mopping prowess with Eufy X8 Pro’s Active Detangling™ technology, further enhanced by a self-emptying system. Its standout feature, the MopMaster 2.0™, exerts a kilogram of pressure for superior cleaning. At the same time, its new mop design ensures thorough corner cleaning. The device, priced at 799 euros, will hit the market in February 2024.
Soundcore Boom 2 – CES 2024 Anker Innovations
Also unveiled is the Soundcore Boom 2, a successor to the popular Boom speaker. Priced at 129.99 euros, this device promises a 60-watt, bass-heavy sound experience courtesy of BassUp™ technology. Its IPX7 certification and floating capability make it a versatile choice for outdoor enthusiasts.
Anker Soloix C800 and C800 Plus
Anker SOLIX introduces two power stations, the C800 Plus and C800, designed for outdoor adventures. The C800 Plus, priced at 699 euros, features LED camping lights and a tripod, with a quick recharge capability using Hyper-Flash technology. The SOLIX C800, slightly more affordable at 649 euros, shares similar specifications without additional lighting options.
The Anker SOLIX F3800, a wheel powerhouse, will also be available. This 3.84-kilowatt-hour battery station, priced at 3699 pounds, offers exceptional power delivery and portability and is recognised as a “CES 2024 Innovation Awards Honoree”.
Ankerwork S600 Conference Speaker
Finally, the AnkerWork S600 conference speaker, retailing for 179.99 euros, is introduced for office and remote work environments. It features advanced voice recognition and AI noise suppression, ensuring clear communication in any setting.
About Anker
Anker Innovations, a prominent name in the technology landscape, stands out for its innovative and user-focused electronic products. Established in 2011, this Chinese company has rapidly expanded its reach globally, catering to a diverse range of consumer electronics. Anker is renowned for its portable power banks, charging cables, and wall chargers, setting industry standards with its pioneering PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technologies. Moreover, the brand has diversified into smart home products, wireless headphones, and speakers under its sub-brands like Soundcore, Eufy, Nebula, and Roav. Anker’s commitment to quality and customer satisfaction and its knack for integrating cutting-edge technology into everyday gadgets solidifies its position as a go-to brand for tech enthusiasts and regular users.
About Eufy
Eufy, a subsidiary of Anker Innovations, is a rapidly growing smart home and cleaning technology brand. Launched in 2016, Eufy specialises in creating a range of intelligent devices designed to enhance home living, emphasising convenience and user-friendliness. Their product lineup includes robot vacuum cleaners, cordless stick vacuums, smart scales, and an array of home security products, including smart cameras and doorbells. Eufy’s robot vacuums have garnered attention for their innovative features like intelligent navigation, powerful suction, and long battery life, all encapsulated in sleek, user-friendly designs. With a focus on integrating advanced technology with everyday home appliances, Eufy is carving out a significant niche in the smart home market, making high-tech living accessible to a broader audience.
About Soundcore
Soundcore, another flourishing sub-brand under the Anker Innovations umbrella, has rapidly gained recognition in the audio technology market since its inception. Specialising in a wide range of audio products, Soundcore is renowned for its wireless headphones, earbuds, and Bluetooth speakers that blend exceptional sound quality with affordability. Their innovative approach is evident in features like custom graphene drivers, hybrid active noise cancellation, and BassUp technology, catering to audiophiles and casual listeners. Soundcore’s commitment to delivering immersive sound experiences matches its focus on sleek design and long-lasting battery life, making its products a popular choice for those seeking quality audio on the go. The brand’s ability to consistently introduce products with cutting-edge audio technology at competitive prices has established Soundcore as a critical player in the global audio equipment industry.

results.content: CES 2024 Day 2 has proven once again that the world of consumer electronics is ever-evolving, with products ranging from nostalgic cassette players to high-end audio systems. As the event unfolds ...
results.raw_content:
CES 2024 Day 2 Takeaways: McIntosh, Sonus Faber, SVS, and More in Spotlight
CES 2024 Day 2 Takeaways: McIntosh, Sonus Faber, SVS, and More in Spotlight
CES 2024 Day 2 Takeaways: McIntosh, Sonus Faber, SVS, and More in Spotlight
The Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2024 in Las Vegas is in full swing, and the second day of this prestigious tech event has brought forth a plethora of intriguing innovations and exciting product launches. From cutting-edge audio technology to retro-inspired devices and smart home integrations, CES 2024 Day 2 showcased the diversity and creativity that continue to define the world of consumer electronics. Here are some key takeaways from the event's second day so far.
McIntosh, celebrating its 75th anniversary, introduced the MC2.1KW Monoblock Power Amplifier, a powerful statement in audio amplification. With 2,000 Watts of power and a design paying tribute to McIntosh's legacy, this amplifier sets a new standard. Featuring advanced technologies, including McIntosh's Autoformer, it promises versatility and pristine sound quality. The limited edition 75th-anniversary badging adds an extra layer of exclusivity for fans of the brand.
Audio-Technica, known for its high-quality audio equipment, unveiled the ATH-TWX7 true wireless earbuds. These earbuds combine 5.8mm high-resolution drivers with advanced digital hybrid noise-canceling technology, ensuring a remarkable audio experience. Users can enjoy up to 6.5 hours of playback time and access a range of features through the Connect app. With sustainability in mind, the packaging is also eco-friendly.
Sonus Faber, the Italian luxury speaker manufacturer, made a grand entrance at CES 2024 Day 2 with its Suprema speaker system. Priced at a staggering $750,000, this speaker system signifies the brand's "commitment to excellence in audio and craftsmanship". The system comes in two variants, the Suprema 2.1 and the Suprema 2.2, each promising an immersive audio experience.
The design of the Suprema speaker system pays homage to the brand's heritage, featuring a lute-shaped main speaker and elliptical subwoofers. Materials like carbon fiber, wood, and leather from luxury furniture brand Poltrona Frau adorn the speakers. With a complex driver system, a chamber lined with recycled cork, and precision in every aspect, the Suprema series exemplifies audio excellence.
Klipsch and Onkyo have joined forces to introduce the Flexus soundbar system, bringing a new level of versatility to home audio. While specific details are yet to be revealed, the Flexus system is expected to support casting from iPhone and Android devices to Echo Show and Fire TV Stick, promising a simplified audio experience.
Google's announcement about bringing Fast Pair to Chromecast with Google TV is a notable enhancement in the smart home segment. This upgrade simplifies the pairing process for headphones and earbuds, enhancing user convenience. Additionally, Google's commitment to expanding Chromecast capabilities and integrating Matter, the smart home ecosystem, into Google TV and Android TV devices, indicates a significant step forward in smart home technology.
Amazon, not to be outdone, announced the addition of Matter Casting to Echo Show devices and Fire TV Sticks. This move allows users to cast content from various streaming services directly to Amazon’s smart devices, a feature that is likely to enhance the functionality and appeal of Amazon's product ecosystem.
Shokz, renowned for its bone-conduction and running earbuds, introduced the OpenSwim Pro at CES 2024, catering primarily to swimmers and fitness enthusiasts. These Bluetooth 5.3-enabled headphones are not limited to swimming; they are suitable for various physical activities. With an IP68 waterproof rating, 32GB of onboard memory for storing up to 8000 MP3 files, and an impressive 15-hour battery life, the OpenSwim Pro aims to be the ultimate multisport headphones.
FiiO, typically associated with cutting-edge audio technology, surprised attendees at CES 2024 Day 2 by unveiling a cassette player reminiscent of the iconic Sony Walkman. The CP13 cassette player pays homage to the first Walkman player from 1979 while incorporating modern design elements. It includes large playback buttons, a volume dial, and a USB-C port for charging. With a 15-hour battery life, the CP13 is a nostalgic nod to the past.
EarFun showcased its EarFun Wave Pro over-ear wireless headphones and UBoom X portable Bluetooth speaker. With features like hybrid ANC, support for high-resolution audio via LDAC, and impressive battery life, these products offer quality audio solutions at a more accessible price point.
SVS, renowned for high-performance audio products, unveiled the Ultra Evolution series, including tower models, bookshelf speakers, a center channel, and an elevation speaker.
The flagship SVS Ultra Evolution Pinnacle stands out with its impressive specs, featuring a centrally placed 1-inch Diamond Coated Tweeter and four 8-inch woofers. The series maintains SVS's commitment to acoustic excellence and offers a range of options for audiophiles and home theater enthusiasts.
CES 2024 Day 2 has proven once again that the world of consumer electronics is ever-evolving, with products ranging from nostalgic cassette players to high-end audio systems.
As the event unfolds, it's evident that the world of consumer electronics is thriving with creativity and diversity, promising exciting times ahead for tech enthusiasts.
Stay tuned for more updates from CES 2024 as we bring you the latest developments and highlights from the world's largest tech showcase.
